inn1.comm: well wide of off stump, he's started with a real loosener

dropped! Oh, a chance straight away, though a tough one for Smith at point. It was shortish and wide of off, bounced a bit more than Tharanga expected and he cut uppishly, Smith hurled himself high to his left and just got his fingertips to it. Very tough chance.
left alone outside off
pushed to cover, can't beat the field
beaten outside off, that's a good ball from McKay, nips away off the seam
pushed away defensively towards point
another good ball, angling across the left-hander from a leg-stump line, he's got it away off a thick edge and pad down to fine leg
there's an appeal first up for Johnson, though he didn't seem entirely convinced. It was a good ball - right on off stump and hits Tharanga on the flap of the back pad, not a bad shout actually.
right on line, Tharanga defends
on the hips at 144kph, it's worked away through square leg
super bounce and pace! That was 143kph but rising from chest height as it went past Dilshan, who tried to cut. Haddin did extremely well to take that high above his head in his right hand
146kph and on off stump, Dilshan drives wide of cover and gets off the mark
down leg side, worst ball of a good over, Tharanga gets it fine enough to beat Doherty at fine leg
ah yes, McKay is doing well here also - he's jagged it back off the seam and Dilshan plays outside that one, takes it on the back thigh
gone! McKay makes the breakthrough, it was on the pads, Dilshan tried to flick it through square leg but only succeeded in lofting it to Hussey, who was in the circle between midwicket and square leg
left alone outside off
worked away to square leg, can't beat Hussey
good delivery! Beats the outside edge of Sangakkara's bat, that was pitched just outside leg and seams away enough to fly past the edge on or just outside off stump
two in the over for McKay! This one seams away as well, but started outside off stump and the width enticed Sangakkara to slash at that one, a thin little edge is taken by Haddin
cut hard and in the air but Tharanga gets it just over cover-point, and right off the meat of the bat. Clarke hurled his hand up in the air but wasn't quite tall enough
beaten outside off, good line, good length, good comeback
fullish and straight, Tharanga defends
146kph from Johnson just outside off, Tharanga pushes to cover

confidence from Tharanga, he gets a short one wide of off and cuts uppishly, not trying to keep it down, but he's placed it safely wide of third man, who runs around to his left to cut off the boundary
cut to point, Smith does the fielding
probing line just outside off, Jayawardene defends
on the pads and this one holds up a little off the pitch, which may have been what also did for Dilshan, and Mahela nudges it safely to leg

McKay gets his third! Very sharp catch by Cameron White at second slip as Jayawardene drives hard at a ball on a good length outside off, there might have been a little seam movement away and it flew off a thick edge high to White's right
defended away safely to cover
oh, another good ball, this one swings in, which surprised Silva and it struck him on the left leg, fortunately for Silva it was heading down leg
beautiful on-drive from Silva after McKay overpitches and oversteps, Ferguson chases it down and dives inside the boundary but they've managed to run four. And now we have a free hit
ah, Silva can't get the free hit away, it was a well-directed bouncer that Silva tried to hook, and he couldn't connect
oh my goodness! This one has somehow missed the outside edge and the off stump, quick and well-directed
pushed away to cover, 147kph from Johnson, who's looking better in this short spell than he has for a little while
on the back foot, Tharanga punches to cover

oh, missed run-out! Tharanga pushed to mid-off and took off for a single, Silva wasn't interested and the fielder, Starc, threw at the striker's end but couldn't find the stumps, allowing Tharanga to get back. Phew, close call. Haddin hadn't got to the stumps yet to make the take.
on the pads, can't get it away
on the back foot, Tharanga gets a thickish edge that runs away safely to third man
Tharanga gets some width and chases it, flays a cover-drive in the air wide of the fielder, that runs away to the boundary
straighter ball and fuller, Tharanga has another hefty swing and this one flies off a thickish edge high towards third man, but it's too square for the fielder
nice comeback, McKay pitches on middle stump and seams it away, it was a good length and beat the bat
on the pads, Tharanga gets it away to third man
wide of off, Silva defends
again it's probing outside off, Silva defends
angled in to off stump, Tharanga defends
good shot, Tharanga steps across to an inswinger just outside off and drives wide of cover, well placed
on the off stump, Silva nudges it behind square with soft hands
pushed towards mid-on, can't find the gap
short outside off, Tharanga doesn't play
pushed away defensively to cover
inside edge onto the pads, almost squeezes through towards the stumps
clipped away through midwicket, that's a good shot from Silva, who kept it along the ground
defended towards mid-off
angled bat from Silva, who nudges to point
on the pads, Silva can't quite get it through the gap at square leg
good ball, bounces and surprises Silva, who defends uppishly
aggressive pull there from Tharanga, but he doesn't time it and the ball finds midwicket
good ball, even though it was only 134kph, the bounce surprised Tharanga, who dropped his bottom hand off the bat as he defended that one
short outside off, Tharanga slashes hard at a cut but straight to the man at point - the batsman will be disappointed not to have found the gap there
this time Tharanga's cut does find the gap! Well played to a bad ball, short and wide of off, he didn't try to keep it down but placed it safely behind point and too square for third man
punched to cover, can't find the gap
better line from Johnson, on off stump and it's defended

ooh, a close attempted run-out, Silva nudged it to midwicket and took off quickly, which was a brave thing to do as the fielder was Mike Hussey, who threw down the stumps at the bowler's end with Silva safely in his ground
again that's sharp running, worked off the hips behind square and they run hard to get two
on off stump, defended back down the pitch
beaten outside off, good ball of a better length and angling away, Tharanga tried to cover-drive
ooh, chipped in the air to mid-on but just short of the fielder, that one held up a little off the pitch, landed only a metre or two in front of Callum Ferguson
worked away to third man for a single
on target at 127kph, swinging in just a fraction, Tharanga defends

inswing once more but misdirected down leg, Haddin dives across and just gets a glove on that to nudge it down. Marais Erasmus has called that a wide, but I thought there was a noise on that and the ball had brushed the pad
probing length outside off, as Watson tries to allow the ball to swing, Silva drives to mid-off
bouncer - wide of off and the batsman sways safely out of the way
on off stump and Silva blocks it back down the pitch
wrong line down leg, Silva flicks it to square leg and can't get a run - he'll be disappointed with that

is that out! No, it's bounced just short. That was a good, fullish outswinger that tempted Silva into a full-blooded drive that sailed in the air to point, Steven Smith  takes it low to the ground but immediately signals to the umpires that the ball bounced short of him
good ball moving away just a fraction, Tharanga defends
good line again, outside off at 138kph, Tharanga leaves it alone
edged and just short! Starc has started well here - got a thick edge out of Tharanga and the ball bounces quite a way short of Watson at first slip
short and wide of off, Tharanga chases it and can't connect, but that's called a wide
ah, beaten outside off at 141kph with good sharp bounce, Tharanga couldn't get bat on ball
another very wide ball, this one Tharanga does connect with and slashes on the up to third man, it bounces safely short of Xavier Doherty
some decent seam movement from Starc, who nibbles it back in to the right hander, who takes it in the midriff
inswinger on the off stump, Tharanga drives to mid-off
cut into the turf and it's collected by slip
bouncer but misdirected a little down leg, that's called a wide
driven in the air and mistimed, but that's landed safely between midwicket and mid-on
Watson is getting good inswing to the left-hander, Tharanga drives this to mid-on

Watson makes the breakthrough! He's swung it in to Tharanga, who pushed forward without much intent, the ball struck him in line and Erasmus says that's out. Pitched in line, straightened well and the only question was height, but it looked good at first glance.
outside off and swinging away, Mathews leaves it alone
Starc pushes this across the right-hander, who leaves it alone
on a good length on off stump, Silva defends
on the pads, it's worked away through square leg
just outside off at 138kph, cramping the batsman a little, but he manages to nudge a single to mid-on
good running, pushed to midwicket with soft hands and they turn the strike over with a quick single
swinging in towards leg stump, Mathews clips through square leg for a couple
full and swinging away, it's driven to cover
on off stump, Chamara Silva defends
clipped to midwicket and Silva wants a run, Ferguson is quickly on to that to deny him
in the air and just safe! Silva has hooked but doesn't get hold of that at all, Ferguson at midwicket ran back and just couldn't get to it in time, not far off a catch chance
down leg side, that's a wide
almost played on, a thick inside edge on to the pad and from there it could have gone anywhere - luckily for Mathews that has bounced towards gully to allow a single
nudged to midwicket, can't find the gap
good inswing from Starc, attacking the stumps and Mathews works it through square leg
no shot offered outside off
wrong line, down leg and swinging further down, it's a wide
oh, half a shout from Starc as Silva shoulders arms to a ball that angles across and then straightens, would have just missed off but it's a dangerous ploy to leave that
fullish outside off and that's a good square drive, Smith in the deep collects that
shortish and it's left alone
confident and full-blooded cover drive this time, Silva throws everything at that and picks up three as the sweeper Steven Smith collects
attacking the stumps again, it's pushed back to Watson
a hint of outswing, it's been nudged towards cover
slower ball down leg side a touch, that's a wide
angled bat from Silva, who just pushes along the ground to point
ah, good outswing from Watson and Silva dabs at that, tries to guide through gully but it beats the bat
bouncer and well-directed, Silva ducks it
and a second bouncer to surprise Silva, again he ducks underneath it
curving in towards the pads, it's worked down to fine leg for a couple of runs
defended back down the pitch
ah yes, Doherty beats the batsman this time with his first ball that has turned, outside off and Mathews looked to dab it fine
pushed to point, can't beat the field
98kph, that's quick stuff for a spinner, it's driven down towards long-off
again flat and quick, on line and defended
good line on off stump at 135kph, Mathews defends
almost inside-edge onto the stumps, it's sneaked past towards square leg to allow him a single
nice line from Watson, on off stump and swinging away just a teensy bit - Silva defends
slower ball on leg stump, it runs off the pads through to Haddin
straight-bat defence from Silva
again full enough to swing, squares the batsman up and a thick edge runs away to third man
a delicate little dab from Silva, who looks to sweep fine and gets a top edge down towards fine leg
driven to cover and can't beat the field
outside off, Silva prods to cover
good curve in to the right-hander, Silva does well to sweep it fine but it's been well fielded on the boundary to cut off a couple of runs
drifting in at 91kph, straight-bat defence
wider of off and Silva latches on to that one, cuts hard behind point and finds the boundary, not the best ball Doherty has delivered
angled across Mathews, who drives to cover
straighter line now, pushed back defensively to Starc
sprayed a little too wide of off, and it's called as an extra
similar ball, this one is also called a wide though I must say that was a bit harsh - it went past the batsman just inside the lines that are meant to guide the umpires
beaten outside off, good, straighter delivery
got him! Starc is ecstatic as he collects his first ODI wicket! Angled across Mathews, who was on the move and trying to drive through off, a thick inside edge rockets back onto the leg stump
outside off stump, left alone
on the stumps, Mendis works it to square leg and can't find a gap
good drift in from outside off, chopped down into the turf to slip
right on line, Silva sweeps from on middle and gets it away behind square leg
Mendis lunges forward to defend
good sharp turn this time, Mendis backs away to cut and can't beat the field
worked away through square leg and Mendis is off the mark
Silva gets forward to defend with a straight bat
down leg side and Mendis tickles it away to deep backward square
left alone outside off
banged in short of a length, Silva can't get that away and takes it on the midriff
good line at 140kph, not giving Silva any room outside off, he defends it straight down at his feet
fuller and straighter, trying to sneak one through, Silva gets the bat down to defend
cut down to third man but it wasn't wide enough for Silva to get it off the middle of the bat
good drift in to the right-hander, who defends

and again Silva tries the sweep from middle stump, it's a dangerous ploy and he hasn't got that off the bat, Doherty asks the question without any support and in fact that's not a bad appeal - struck the pad in front of middle, though height was an issue

turns down leg and Haddin whips the bails off as Mendis threatens to lift his back leg - he's just kept the toe grounded. Erasmus asks for the replay and Mendis is safe, though he lifts his foot just after the bails come off. A tight one, in the end, though it looked innocuous at first
worked away behind square leg
soft hands from Silva, who nudges to point
slower from Doherty at 89kph, it's pushed to cover for a quick single
on the back foot, Mendis punches through cover
full, yorker length ball wide of off at 141kph, Mendis drives to cover
cut hard in the air and one bounce to Watson at third man, Mendis wasn't exactly in control of that
ah yes, good bounce from Starc, who beats the bat outside off with a ball that's still on the rise as it gets to Haddin
cut forward of point, there's a man in the deep to keep that to one

gone! Starc gets his second with another ball that bounces sharply off a good length, Mendis has just tried to defend that ball and a thick edge is taken at chest height by Haddin, very good bowling from Starc
straight ball, it's defended safely
short and swivelled through midwicket with an ungainly sort of pull
ah, good bounce from McKay and Randiv gets it high off the bat, it lobs to the vacant gully region
cut towards point, can't beat the field
oh, for about the fourth time this innings the batsman has cut on the up to third man, only for the ball to bounce a metre or two short - risky stuff
punched off the back foot to point, where Smith hurls himself to his right and makes an excellent save
this one nips in to the right-hander, who defends
yorker outside off, it's jammed out towards point
bouncer, Silva ducks underneath it
good sharp bounce again from Starc, Silva sways out of the way

Starc has three! And two of them from batsmen playing on! Silva has tried to drive through off, almost down on one knee as he plays it, he hasn't judged the angle quite right and a thick inside edge crashes into the stumps
good sharp bounce again, that's what has had the Sri Lankans worried about Starc this innings, Perera defends warily

shouts of catch it! But they can't - it was a good bouncer, well-directed and in trying to get out of the way Perera has skewed it in the air off the bat towards gully, second slip and backward point converge and it lands between them
shortish and on line, Perera ducks it
worked away off the hips for a boundary, fine leg can't save that, so the Powerplay has started well for Sri Lanka as they finally reach their 100
wrong line from McKay, wide down leg side
leading edge lands safely - Perera didn't know much about that one. In fact it's off the shoulder of the bat, lobs in the air to a silly-point sort of position
good shot, Perera pulls that confidently over midwicket but there's a man in the deep

good catch from Smith! Perera threw everything at that one to a fuller ball, it's flown off a leading edge towards point, Smith looks to chase it back behind square but then has to adjust his movement, and takes it well above his head, facing back towards third man. That was not an easy catch, but Smith made it look pretty comfortable in the end.
edged through the vacant third slip region, third man collects
angled across Randiv, who drives to cover
Malinga! He's not going to defend too much - backs away and slaps it back to the bowler, trying for a boundary - from his first ball!
again he tries for a big shot, but this one is too short for Malinga to reach, and it's called a wide
Malinga backs off again and Starc does well to push it across outside off, wide enough that Malinga couldn't reach it, but only because he'd backed off, so it wasn't called a wide
again Malinga gives himself room, drives this one to cover
pulled away through midwicket, it's chased down inside the boundary
Malinga throws everything at that, trying to slog it over midwicket, he can't connect
not a bad ball from McKay, good line and length, but Randiv has crunched this one forward of point for a boundary, making use of the Powerplay
and McKay comes back with a similar ball, but one that bounces a fraction more, and it beats the bat
McKay has five! That's what the Aussies need to do against the tail - aim at the stumps! Randiv was backing off and opening the shoulders, he missed and McKay hit the off stump
Fernando opens the face and runs it towards second slip, who knocks it down on the bounce
backs off and tries for a powerful pull but McKay follows him and beats the bat
beaten outside off
shortish and wide of off, Fernando chases it but can't connect
beaten outside off again, sails over off stump
tip and run from Fernando, who pushes to cover and Smith hares across from point to throw down the stumps at the non-striker's end, but Fernando was well and truly home
Malinga swings wildly and can't connect
slower one now, Malinga swings and misses
It's all over for Sri Lanka, Starc finishes with four as Malinga pulls over midwicket but gets it high off the bat, Ferguson at deep midwicket gets underneath that and has no trouble taking the catch

inn2.comm: Watson is off the mark immediately with a cut behind point that is collected by third man
good ball, quick at 143kph and swinging away a touch, Haddin hangs the bat out half-heartedly
left alone safely, another one that swings away
short of a length now, Haddin defends on the back foot
full and swinging away, Haddin gets a thick edge through a fourth-slip sort of region, and that's good running to hurry back for two
short of a length, Haddin lets it through to Sangakkara
good shot, it was a half-volley outside off and Watson drives square, between point and cover and picks up three runs
oops, Fernando has over-stepped here, Haddin guides it to third man and Watson will have a free hit
bouncer, Watson swings everything at this free hit, gets a top edge that flies over the keeper's head and is collected on the bounce by third man

oh dear, Fernando has no-balled again, it's a bouncer that has proven too tough for Sangakkara, who knocks it down but they run a bye. Another free hit coming up - and Fernando was way over the crease
Haddin gets the free hit this time and it's a wide ball, too far outside off - so the free-hit carries on to the next delivery
this time the free hit is better directed, shortish outside off and Haddin's attempted cut doesn't connect
better ball, right on off stump and Haddin defends
defended behind point, Haddin picks up a single
good yorker just outside off, Watson jams the bat down on that
another wide called now, as Malinga sprays it outside off and Haddin's flat-footed swipe doesn't connect, perhaps luckily for the batsman
swinging away from Haddin, who angles the bat down to Fernando at third man, and that's good running to get back for two. Fernando wasn't very alert in the field
straight-bat defence from Haddin
full toss down leg side, Haddin clips it away to deep square leg and just gets a single - that would most definitely have been a wide, anyway, had Haddin not chased it
that's a shocker - bouncer waaaaay down leg side and Sangakkara does well to take that
flicked off his pads to fine leg
crunched towards cover point but can't beat the field
good ball, swinging away a touch, and Haddin defends
Fernando tries for the yorker but it's just a bit too full, Watson clips it through midwicket and finds the gap with ease
slower at 135kph, Watson gets a leading edge that lobs safely into the off side
sharpish! Very good bouncer at 145kph and reasonably well-directed. Watson sways out of the way. It was just outside off, a touch straighter and he might have clattered the helmet of Watto
Watson gets forward to defend
149.6kph! Watson flays at a square drive to a wide-ish ball that sails through to Sangakkara, on the rise as it reaches him
and Fernando has touched 150 - 150.1kph in fact. Watson drops it at his feet and scurries through for a single
banged in short and Watson pulls that high over midwicket, it looked powerful off the bat but has actually chipped into the turf and pulled up inside the boundary
pushed away defensively
straight line from Malinga, Haddin defends
bad ball down leg, Haddin goes after it and manages to work a couple of runs through square leg
beaten outside off, good ball that nips away a little
lovely stroke! Haddin gets onto the back foot and simply punches a drive through cover, finds the gap and gets his first boundary of the innings
full toss down leg, Sangakkara launches himself to his left and does well to save a boundary's worth of wides
Fernando strikes! Good ball at 150kph and cramped Watson a bit, he's tried to open the face and cut that to third man but it was too close, he's simply guided it to Mathews at first slip
good line on off, Clarke defends
shortish ball goes through to the keeper
swings down leg, Clarke is struck on the pads
oh, lucky way for Clarke to get off the mark! He's got a bouncer, went for the pull and got a top edge that has sailed over the wicketkeeper's head. It's bounced just inside the rope - almost six!
on the back foot, Clarke defends
good start from Perera, on a good length on off stump, it's driven back to the bowler
Haddin waits on this one and cuts to third man
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
driven away towards cover
on the hips, Clarke clips it away behind square and the single turns into a double as the fielder slides and flicks it over his team-mate's head
defended away safely
slower ball at 133kph and sliding down leg, Haddin flicks that off his pads in the air over square leg, and it's been reeled in on the boundary by Perera
worked off his pads for a single
defended away safely
sways out of the way of that one
Haddin punches to cover
pushed away towards cover
on-driven, and fluently by Clarke for four
shorter ball and Clarke pivots and pulls to the boundary
outside off stump this time and Clarke lets it go
played off the pads towards square leg
a bouncer but it's too high and soars over a leaping Sangakkara, who gets a bit of glove on it, the fielder pulls it in just inside the boundary
defended on the leg side
too short and Clarke moves back and swats it from outside off through midwicket, well timed and superbly placed
Clarke fends and plays the ball with the shoulder of the bat on the on-side
short of a length and the ball rises on Haddin who jumps to play it down near his toes
pushed off the back foot towards point and Haddin begins to walk off for the break
Clarke uses his feet straight away, and drives down to long-on for a single
Haddin goes for a swing over midwicket but gets it off the toe of the bat down to long-off
advances again and this time defends
Mendis drops short now and the pull from Clarke is hauled in on the square-leg boundary by Malinga
there's the wrong'un, Haddin picks it and pulls high over midwicket and it bounces over the boundary, Mendis just dropped it a little too short
tossed up this time, Haddin drives to long-off
dropped! Oh, it is not Sri Lanka's day at all! And that goes double for Mendis. Haddin drives on the up to mid-off and Jeevan Mendis drops what was really a pretty simple opportunity
driven hard into the turf and back to the bowler
fullish outside off, the drive can't beat cover
banged in short of a length, Haddin waits on that and guides down to third man
straighter ball now, Clarke tucks it away through midwicket
another over-step from Fernando, Haddin pushes to off, and gets himself a free hit
and that's quite well bowled by Fernando, Haddin backs away to give himself room for the free hit, Fernando follows him with a shortish ball that Haddin can only bunt into the off side
yorker, Clarke keeps it out
short and pulled from outside off, Clarke didn't get hold of that and it's run away gently through square leg
well played by Haddin, waited on that one outside off and opened the face to guide it between the slips and gully, all the way along the ground to the third man boundary
yorker on the pads, Haddin pushes to mid-on and hares through for a single
good ball on off, Clarke defends with a straight bat
bouncer, over the head of the ducking Clarke
pushed to point and can't find the gap
short of a length, Haddin jumps back and defends
good ball that swings in a touch, thick edge runs away through square leg
on the back foot, Clarke cuts straight to point
cut hard in the air, on the bounce to third man

Haddin's on his way, Fernando gets a well deserved second wicket, it was a bouncer that got too high on Haddin, who pulled and the top edge flew high in the air, Fernando ran over to short midwicket to take the catch himself. And then threw the ball up and headed it away!
down leg side, that's a good take by a diving Sangakkara
right on line this time, Hussey blocks it away
good, sharp bouncer at 142kph, Hussey ducks his head and gets just underneath it
there's the yorker and a bit slower at 131kph, Hussey drives to cover
short of a length just outside off, Hussey does the limbo to sway out of the way
down leg side again, and another very good diving stop by Sangakkara
fullish outside off, Hussey goes for the square drive but can't connect
Hussey's off the mark with a clip off his toes to fine leg, and he gets back for two
that's a slower bouncer at 125kph, well outside off and Clarke looks to pull, but just dribbles it away to square leg
on the hips, Clarke works it to square leg and it's another no-ball from Fernando, so Hussey gets a free hit
down leg side and Hussey tries to get under it, but the free hit ends up skewing up off the leg onto his helmet, he just gets a quick single
bouncer, Clarke ducks under it
great shot! A slower half-volley at 131kph and Clarke waited on it, then drove straight back past the bowler's right hand, all the way along the ground for a boundary
tucked away behind square leg for another single

is that out? A big lbw shout from Fernando to a ball that has actually pitched outside leg, and immediately umpire Reiffel lifts his right arm. Fernando starts to celebrate,  then realises Reiffel is signalling a no-ball! It was the right call, too.
another free hit goes begging as Hussey swings wildly outside off and misses
Malinga tries for the yorker and gets it a little too full outside off, Clarke can't get bat on ball
on the pads, Clarke clips that confidently through midwicket for a couple of runs to the sweeper
punched to mid-off, can't get it past the fielder
bouncer on the leg stump, Clarke ducks underneath it
another wide down leg side, Malinga's radar has been off quite a few times today
better line outside off, Clarke pushes to mid-off
good solid off-drive from Clarke but Malinga might have just got a hand on that, takes the pace off it and mid-off does the fielding
Hussey nudges that one through cover point and it's good, sharp running to get back for two
good ball on off stump, Hussey pushes to point
straight-bat defence this time
on the pads, Hussey flicks to midwicket
on the hips, Hussey works a single down to Malinga at fine leg
Clarke defends and drops this one at his feet, and they take a very quick and well-judged single
on the pads, Clarke clips a single through square leg
around the wicket to Hussey, who cuts to point
spins away from the left-hander, who lets it go
straighter ball now, Hussey blocks
Randiv drifts it in and turns it, soft hands from Hussey, can't find a gap
straighter ball, tucked through square leg
driven to the leg side, can't beat the field
pushed to cover, no run there
left alone outside off, Hussey's in no hurry here
Hussey drops this one at his feet and wants a run, Clarke doesn't
this one comes in with the angle, Hussey leaves it alone
nudged away to point, no run there and it's a maiden
turns in to Clarke, who backs off and punches it back to the bowler
glorious stuff from Clarke, uses his feet to get to the pitch of it, and lifts this over long-on with superb timing, that's cleared the boundary
on the back foot, Clarke punches through point
tries to work this through leg, but takes it on the thigh
uses the feet again and drives this one along the ground to long on
Hussey leans forward to defend
pushed to point, no run there
drives to cover, can't beat the field
on the move, Clarke drives to point
there's the winning runs! Clarke waits on this and guides it off the face of the bat to third man, the umpire signals four, so he also brings up his half-century
